info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 8:45PM CDT until June 20 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas...
Neosho River near Chanute affecting Allen and Neosho Counties.
Neosho River near Parsons affecting Labette and Neosho Counties.
Neosho River near Erie affecting Neosho County.
Neosho River at Oswego affecting Cherokee and Labette Counties.
Neosho River at Iola affecting Allen County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Neosho River at Iola.
* WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flood waters cover West Bruner Street by Riverside Park.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.6 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 845 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING
